catalog_info.title: Nineteenth-Century Women Writers
catalog_info.description: This seminar explores nineteenth-century writing by British, Caribbean, and South African women who explored a variety of contemporary problems including the woman question, courtship and marriage practices, sexuality and reproduction, racial politics, the institution of slavery, and colonial occupation. We will read novels by Mary Shelley, Jane Austen, Charlotte Brontë, Elizabeth Gaskell, M.E. Braddon, and Olive Schreiner, and shorter works by Mary Prince, George Eliot, Mary Seacole, Florence Nightingale, Christina Rossetti, and others. We will also read contemporary feminist theories that contest the concept of woman and will discuss ways of conceptualizing women's writing without resorting to gender essentialism.
